quiz.question: What was the main demand of the Swadeshi Movement beginning in 1905?
Which year marks the signing of the Treaty of Seringapatam that ended the Third Anglo-Mysore War?
Which leader founded the Servants of India Society in 1905 to promote social reform and education?
In which year was the Indian National Congress founded?
Which battle in 1764 established British dominance after victory over the Nawab of Bengal?
Which reformer campaigned for widow remarriage and female education in 19th century Bengal?
Which movement did Mahatma Gandhi call off after the Chauri Chaura violence in 1922?
Which Indian regiment famously rebelled in Kanpur during the 1857 uprising under Nana Sahib?
Which commission's recommendations in 1902 led to the Morley-Minto reforms and inclusion of Indians in governance?
Who founded the Indian National Congress along with Indian leaders in 1885?
Which Indian reformer founded the Brahmo Samaj in 1828 promoting monotheism and social reform?
Which movement combined the Khilafat agitation and non-cooperation under Gandhi's leadership around 1920?
Which battle in 1526 marked the beginning of Mughal rule in India?
Who chaired the committee that produced the Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms leading to the Government of India Act 1919?
Which leader negotiated the Poona Pact with Ambedkar in 1932 regarding representation for depressed classes?
